column4: hi all, i've installed blender and when i run it, it only show the splash screen and doesn't hide it. I can click on menus. It doesn't show anything about error when i ran it from terminal. How can i fix this, thanks!
have you tried re-installing it? what version(s) of python do you have?
not yet, python 2.6.5
that should work. so you see a splash screen, but it never loads the main GUI?
what are you using? GNOME, KDE, etc?
gnome
are you using compiz?
i set my visual effect at extra but i don't use compiz
how does that work?
what works?
visual effects are compiz.
what version of Ubuntu?
okay, i will change it to normal, 10.04
i changed to normal and no visual but nothing happen
odd... has blender always been this way (you can set your effects back now)
this is the first time i install it
maybe i will remove it and reinstall
nothing else after reinstall, i install it from Ubuntu software center
i use 10.10 and have 2.6.6 and 3.1 installed (with blender) and it works fine. Can you move the window to a different workspace?
2.6.6 and 3.1 being different python versions.
ok, i will install new python ver
i want to ask that when i installed python3, will ubuntu use it to install blender?
blender (i think) only uses python for the extra modules but not sure. blender does not need to be compiled.
http://img33.imageshack.us/img33/5421/screenshotke.png this is my screenshot
